revised_title: Peculiarities in the Distribution of Arteries in Slow-Moving Animals
tldr: The author observed a peculiarity in the distribution of arteries in slow-moving animals like the Lemur tardigradus, Bradypus tridactylus, and didactylus. The arteries to the limbs were suddenly divided into many equal-sized cylinders, which distributed blood to the muscles. This unique configuration might explain the animals' sluggishness and slow blood flow.
